title: Forget Typhoon Hagibis - Japan already have the weapons to batter Scotland
text:
Typhoon Hagibis is not the only storm front poised to hit Scotland's World Cup chances this weekend. Even if the weather clears, they are facing a Japanese side whose speed and control have the potential to cause the Scots all sorts of problems.

The task for Gregor Townsend has been made even more treacherous by the closing minute of the Japan-Samoa game. In the dying seconds of that game, Japan had effectively won, but only with three tries in the bag. Samoa, however, did not want to finish the game with a whimper by kicking the ball out, so opted for a scrum - which was duly demolished.
